```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(graphics)
```

```{r}
cdi = read.csv("data/cdi.csv")


cdi_cor = cdi %>% 
  select(-id,-cty,-state)
  
```
```{r}
cdi.cor = cor(cdi_cor)


library(corrplot)
corrplot(cdi.cor)
```
```{r}

ls(cdi)
data = cdi %>% 
  select(pop,pop18,docs,beds,crimes,poverty,totalinc)



groups <- cdi[, 17] 
# Plot correlation matrix
pairs(data,lower.panel = panel.smooth)


# Equivalent but using the plot function
plot(data) 
```
```{r}
plot(x, y, pch = 19, col = "lightblue")

# Regression line
abline(lm(y ~ x), col = "red", lwd = 3)

# Pearson correlation
text(paste("Correlation:", round(cor(x, y), 2)), x = 25, y = 95)
```
